website_summaries.verdict: One of the most versatile fire blankets that comes in various sizes for different uses.
pros: Fiberglass construction is durable and heat resistant up to around 1,000°F
cons: Blanket may rip when removing it from the pouch

customer_reviews.title: A house saver!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blanket to replace one I used to contain a fire in our toaster oven. I covered the oven with it and carried it outside. It was a housesaver and did not leave the added mess that a fire extinguisher would have.
customer_reviews.author: NWF

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, just needs some upgrades
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fight small fires that might pop up around my workshop. The blanket seems pretty fire resistant based on holding a lighter to it for about thirty seconds. The fabric is itchy, but it's fiberglass, so that is to be expected. My only real complaint is that one of the handles ripped halfway off the first time I took this out of the bag. I don’t think that’s a huge deal since I consider this product to be single use like a fire extinguisher. I ended up putting grommets through the corners and making my own handles which turned out to be a much better solution than sewing them back on.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than replacing your home.
customer_reviews.text: It works. I used it for a fat fire in a large pan and there was no mess afterward
customer_reviews.author: Really....

customer_reviews.title: Just in case...
customer_reviews.text: years ago I had one like it and it saved the day smothering a fire. That one was single use and treated cotton. Couldn't (then) find a replacement. When recounting that story it occurred to me to check online for one like it and found this. It's mounted on the pantry wall steps from the stove should I ever need it. If I ever have to actually use it I'll update.
customer_reviews.author: LapsedUnitarian

customer_reviews.title: Provides peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Having experienced a garage fire that totaled a 4 car garage, when I saw an ad for these fire blankets i decided to buy them for my adult sons in their homes. My husband is getting two for the garage and there’s one in the kitchen. Fire was started when an older, heavy, Boxy, metal power cord got too hot while plugged into a power strip . Hopefully we’ll never need the fire blankets, but it’s nice knowing they’re there.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.

customer_reviews.title: It is nice quality, but it’s one of those things you ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after I lost a neighbor in a fire. It is nice quality, but it’s one of those things you hope to never use. Unless you plan on keeping it near your bed, you’ll likely forget it or be unable to access it during a tragic event of a fire.
customer_reviews.author: MOMSlist

customer_reviews.title: Fire Safety Purchase with No Expiration Date
customer_reviews.text: The package seemed somewhat larger and heavier than expected, however I am encouraged that the product serves the purpose. The brass grommet at the top can be used to suspend the case from a hook. I wish that there were more color choices for the package, while red attracts attention, beige or white could be suspended from a magnetic hook attached to the side of a refrigerator for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: grateful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: We live in an area with a lot of wild fires. I thought these would be perfect for my emergency preparedness kit, go bag or vehicle. The quality is excellent. I am very satisfied and plan to purchase more!
customer_reviews.author: OilysHumbleHome

customer_reviews.title: Quality safety insurance
customer_reviews.text: I bought several and keep a pair in each car in case get trapped on roadway during a firestorm. I tuck them in the pocket behind each seat, along with a dust / smoke mask. Small price/room taken up for this large amount of effective insurance. Have not had to use but a few tests of a corner convinced me it is a quality item. Outer pouch seems to hold up well. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Fire blanket
customer_reviews.text: I think every home should have this. I have never needed to use this ..thankfully, but it's an extra security measure. Note to anyone who does buy this: the blanket has fiber glass all over it. I took it out of the bag to look at it then folded it back and my skin was on inflamed with painful rashes for hours.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent additional option for putting out a fire.
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite impressed with this item. This is a great additional option to have for putting out a small fire if you don't want to blast your entire place with white power with a chemical extinguisher and then spend the next two weeks trying to clean it up.

This reviewer would have given this product 5 stars if it had better quality control. Hopefully, we will never have to use the fire blanket.
